canonical_explanation.text: A point is an exact location in space with no size. A line extends infinitely in both directions. A ray starts at a point and extends infinitely in one direction. A line segment has two endpoints. Parallel lines never meet. Intersecting lines cross at a point. Perpendicular lines meet at right angles (90 degrees).
rules: A point is represented by a dot, named by a capital letter (P)
A line has no endpoints, extends infinitely (line AB or AB with arrows)
A ray has one endpoint and extends infinitely in one direction (ray AB)
A line segment has two endpoints (segment AB or AB with bar)
Parallel lines are always the same distance apart and never meet

questions.question_text: Which has no endpoint?
questions.explanation_correct: A line extends infinitely in both directions and has no endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line has no endpoints. A ray has one endpoint. A line segment has two endpoints.

questions.question_text: How many endpoints does a ray have?
questions.explanation_correct: A ray has exactly one endpoint (its starting point) and extends infinitely in one direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ray starts at one point (endpoint) and goes on forever in one direction.

questions.question_text: A line segment has:
questions.explanation_correct: A line segment has exactly two endpoints and a definite length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment is the part of a line between two points (endpoints).

questions.question_text: A point has size and shape.
questions.explanation_correct: A point represents an exact location. It has no size, length, width, or shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A point has no dimensions — it is just a position in space.

questions.question_text: How many lines can pass through a single point?
questions.explanation_correct: Through a single point, infinitely many lines can pass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Unlimited lines can pass through a single point, in all possible directions.

questions.question_text: How many lines can pass through two different points?
questions.explanation_correct: Through two different points, exactly one line can be drawn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two points determine exactly one line.

questions.question_text: Lines that never meet are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Parallel lines are always the same distance apart and never intersect.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines maintain equal distance and never meet, no matter how far they extend.

questions.question_text: Perpendicular lines form an angle of:
questions.explanation_correct: Perpendicular lines intersect at right angles (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perpendicular lines meet at exactly 90 degrees (a right angle).

questions.question_text: Which is an example of parallel lines from daily life?

options.text: The hands of a clock at 3 o'clock

questions.explanation_correct: Railway tracks run parallel to each other — they are always the same distance apart and never meet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Railway tracks are a perfect example of parallel lines in everyday life.

questions.question_text: Two lines that cross each other at a point are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Lines that cross at a point are intersecting lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When two lines meet at a point, they are called intersecting lines.

questions.question_text: All perpendicular lines are intersecting lines, but not all intersecting lines are perpendicular.
questions.explanation_correct: Perpendicular lines intersect at 90 degrees, so they are a special case of intersecting lines. Other intersecting lines can meet at other angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perpendicular lines are a subset of intersecting lines (those that meet at 90°).

questions.question_text: The edge of your ruler represents a:
questions.explanation_correct: A ruler's edge has two ends, so it represents a line segment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ruler edge has a definite start and end — it is a line segment.

questions.question_text: A beam of light from a torch represents a:
questions.explanation_correct: A torch beam starts at one point (the torch) and goes on in one direction — like a ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A torch beam has a starting point and extends in one direction, like a ray.

questions.question_text: The letter L contains:
questions.explanation_correct: The letter L is made of two line segments meeting at a right angle (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: L has two line segments meeting at 90 degrees — they are perpendicular.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: a line or a line segment?
questions.explanation_correct: A line extends infinitely in both directions, so it is always longer than any line segment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line is infinitely long, while a line segment has a fixed length.

questions.question_text: The letter Z contains:
questions.explanation_correct: In Z, the top and bottom horizontal lines are parallel, and the diagonal line intersects both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Z has two parallel horizontal lines connected by an intersecting diagonal.

questions.question_text: The floor and walls of a room meet at ___ angles.
questions.explanation_correct: Floors and walls are perpendicular, meeting at right angles (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walls are perpendicular to the floor, forming 90-degree angles.

questions.question_text: Can two rays share the same starting point?

options.text: Only if they go in the same direction

questions.explanation_correct: When two rays share a common starting point, they form an angle. The shared point is the vertex.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two rays with a common endpoint form an angle.

questions.question_text: Which letter has parallel lines?
questions.explanation_correct: H has two vertical parallel lines connected by a horizontal line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter H has two parallel vertical lines.

questions.question_text: In your classroom, identify parallel lines:
questions.explanation_correct: Opposite edges of a blackboard (top and bottom, or left and right) are parallel lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Opposite edges of a rectangular blackboard are parallel.

questions.question_text: A point is usually named using a:
questions.explanation_correct: Points are named using capital letters: Point A, Point B, Point P, etc.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We use capital letters to name points: A, B, C, P, Q, etc.

questions.question_text: The + sign is formed by:
questions.explanation_correct: The + sign has two line segments crossing at right angles (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The plus sign shows two perpendicular line segments.

questions.question_text: The opposite sides of a rectangular notebook are parallel.
questions.explanation_correct: In a rectangle, opposite sides are always parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: True. A rectangle has two pairs of parallel sides.

questions.question_text: How is a line different from a ray?

options.text: A line has no endpoints, a ray has one endpoint

questions.explanation_correct: A line extends infinitely in both directions (no endpoints). A ray starts at one point and extends infinitely in one direction (one endpoint).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Key difference: line = 0 endpoints (both directions infinite), ray = 1 endpoint.

questions.question_text: Which pair of lines can never form an angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Parallel lines never meet, so they cannot form an angle between them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines never intersect, so no angle is formed.

questions.question_text: The minimum number of points needed to draw a line segment is ___
questions.explanation_correct: A line segment is defined by two endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two points define a line segment.

questions.question_text: Which shape has all sides perpendicular to adjacent sides?
questions.explanation_correct: In a rectangle, every pair of adjacent sides meets at a right angle (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has all 90-degree angles, meaning all adjacent sides are perpendicular.

questions.question_text: How many pairs of parallel sides does a square have?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 2 pairs of parallel sides: top-bottom and left-right.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has 2 pairs of parallel sides.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can be measured?
questions.explanation_correct: Only a line segment has a definite length that can be measured. Lines and rays are infinite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment has two endpoints and a fixed length that can be measured.

questions.question_text: A clock showing 3:00 has its hands forming:
questions.explanation_correct: At 3:00, the hour and minute hands form a 90-degree angle (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 3 o'clock, the hands are at right angles (perpendicular).

questions.question_text: Two parallel lines can meet if extended far enough.
questions.explanation_correct: By definition, parallel lines never meet, no matter how far they are extended.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines maintain constant distance and never intersect.

questions.question_text: A sunray coming through a window represents:
questions.explanation_correct: Sunlight comes from a source (the sun) and travels in one direction — like a ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sunlight travels from a point in one direction, like a ray.

questions.question_text: Which capital letter has neither parallel nor perpendicular lines?
questions.explanation_correct: S is made of curves, not straight lines. It has neither parallel nor perpendicular lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: S consists of curves only, with no straight lines.

questions.question_text: In the letter N, the two vertical lines are:
questions.explanation_correct: The two vertical lines in N are parallel (same direction, never meet).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both vertical lines in N go in the same direction and never meet — they are parallel.

questions.question_text: How many line segments are needed to make a triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A triangle is formed by 3 line segments (its three sides).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangle has 3 sides = 3 line segments.

questions.question_text: The edges of a door and its frame are examples of:
questions.explanation_correct: A door frame has parallel sides (left and right, top and bottom) and perpendicular corners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A door frame has both parallel and perpendicular lines.

questions.question_text: A line segment AB has a definite ___
questions.explanation_correct: A line segment has a definite, measurable length between its two endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment has a fixed, measurable length.

questions.question_text: If two lines meet at a point making all four angles equal, the lines are:
questions.explanation_correct: If all four angles are equal, each is 360÷4 = 90°. Lines meeting at 90° are perpendicular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Four equal angles = 90° each = perpendicular lines.

questions.question_text: Which of these objects has perpendicular edges?
questions.explanation_correct: A book (rectangular shape) has edges meeting at right angles (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A book's rectangular shape has perpendicular edges at each corner.

questions.question_text: The tip of a pencil best represents a:
questions.explanation_correct: The sharp tip of a pencil represents a point — an exact location.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil tip is a tiny spot representing a point.

questions.question_text: The crossbars on a window grill are usually:
questions.explanation_correct: Window grill bars typically cross each other at right angles (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grill bars cross at 90 degrees, making them perpendicular.

questions.question_text: Two different lines can share at most one point.
questions.explanation_correct: Two different lines (not the same line) can either be parallel (0 common points) or intersect (1 common point).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two distinct lines share at most 1 point. If they share 2 or more, they are the same line.

questions.question_text: Horizontal lines on a lined notebook are:
questions.explanation_correct: The ruled lines on a notebook are parallel — equally spaced and never meeting.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Notebook lines run in the same direction with equal spacing — they are parallel.

questions.question_text: How many pairs of perpendicular sides does a rectangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 corners, each with perpendicular adjacent sides. So 4 pairs of perpendicular sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At each of the 4 corners, two sides meet at 90°. So 4 pairs of perpendicular sides.

questions.question_text: How many rays can start from a single point?
questions.explanation_correct: From any point, infinitely many rays can start, each going in a different direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rays can go in any direction from a point, so infinitely many.

questions.question_text: The letter T is formed by:
questions.explanation_correct: T has a horizontal line segment on top and a vertical one below, meeting at right angles (perpendicular).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The horizontal and vertical parts of T are perpendicular.

questions.question_text: The symbol for parallel lines is ___
questions.explanation_correct: Parallel lines are denoted by the symbol || (two vertical bars).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The parallel symbol is || (e.g., AB || CD means line AB is parallel to line CD).

questions.question_text: Which statement is FALSE?

options.text: A line segment has infinite length

questions.explanation_correct: A line segment has a finite (definite) length between its two endpoints. It is NOT infinite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment has a fixed length — it does NOT extend infinitely.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows intersecting lines in real life?
questions.explanation_correct: A road crossing is where two roads meet (intersect).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A road intersection is where two roads cross each other.

questions.question_text: Two perpendicular lines divide a plane into how many parts?
questions.explanation_correct: Two perpendicular lines create 4 right angles and divide the plane into 4 equal parts (quadrants).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two perpendicular lines form 4 regions (quadrants).
